inlineContent.text: library provides a client wrapper for interacting with the Discord API, e.g. to build a chat bot. For a simple example, refer to

code: func client(_ client: DiscordClient, didCreateMessage message: DiscordMessage) {

abstract.text: Write chat bots using the Discord API.
An enum that represents the dispatch events Discord sends.
Indicates one of three situations:
A Snowflake ID representing a Permissions Overwrite
Represents a Discord Permission. Calculating Permissions involves bitwise operations.
Declares that a type will be a delegate for a
. After the client handles any events,
the corresponding delegate method will be called.
A dispatch event.
Sent when a user is banned from a guild.
A visual button component style.
A Snowflake ID representing a Webhook
Sent when a user explicitly removes all reactions of a given emoji from a message.
The DiscordRateLimiter is in charge of making sure we don’t flood Discord with requests.
It keeps a dictionary of DiscordRateLimitKeys and DiscordRateLimits.
All requests to the REST api should be routed through the DiscordRateLimiter.
If a DiscordRateLimit determines we have hit a limit, we add the request and its callback to the limit’s queue.
After that it is up to the DiscordRateLimit to decide when to make the request.
TODO handle the global rate limit
Sent when a message is deleted.

Represents a Guild.
The shard manager is responsible for a client’s shards. It decides when a client is considered connected.
Connected being when all shards have recieved a ready event and are receiving events from the gateway. It also
decides when a client has fully disconnected. Disconnected being when all shards have closed.
An endpoint is made up of a REST api endpoint and any major parameters in that endpoint.
Ex. /channels/232184444340011009/messages and /channels/186926276592795659/messages
Are considered different endpoints
Sent when a role is created/updated on a guild.

A DiscordRateLimiterSpec is in charge of making sure we don’t flood Discord with requests.
It keeps a dictionary of DiscordRateLimitKeys and DiscordRateLimits.
All requests to the REST api should be routed through a DiscordRateLimiterSpec.
